Name: fluorine production, liquid | fluorine, liquid | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: The world’s production of elemental fluorine, except for countries with planned economies, is concentrated in seven countries with an overall capacity of ca 17’000t/a. It is mainly used in two areas: manufacture of UF6 (18’000- 21’000t/a corresponding to 6’000 – 7’000t of F) and direct manufacture of 5’100 – 7’700t/a of SF6, corresponding to 4’000 – 6’000t of F. The rest is required for miscellaneous applications.;In all modern fluorine-production units, the gas is produced by electrolysis of KF•2HF (solution of potassium fluoride in anhydrous hydrogen fluoride with 40.68 wt % HF).  Potassium salts are used to produce the potassium fluoride.;Elemental fluorine production units are integrated into SF6 and UF6 production units to avoid transport difficulties.;Reference:;Jaccaud M., Faron R., Devilliers D. and Romano R. (1999) Fluorine. In: Ullmann's encyclopedia of industrial chemistry: Electronic release, Vol. A11 (ed. Arpe et al.). 6 Edition. Wiley-VCH, Weinheim, D.
